briefdescription.para: Network Specific.
ZigBee (2006)

description.para: Bitfields for flags parameter to a wpan_endpoint_send_fn().
Values for flags field of wpan_cluster_table_entry_t.

briefdescription.para: no flags
input/server cluster (typically receives requests)
output/client cluster (typically receives responses)
both client and server cluster
alias name for input cluster (uses ZCL terminology)
alias name for output cluster (uses ZCL terminology)
Data sent or received by this cluster must be encrypted.

detaileddescription.para: Do not accept unencrypted broadcast messages. If using this flag on a non-ZCL cluster, be sure to set WPAN_CLUST_FLAG_NOT_ZCL as well.

briefdescription.para: Unicast data sent or received by this cluster must be encrypted, but unencrypted broadcast frames are OK.

detaileddescription.para: If using this flag on a non-ZCL cluster, be sure to set WPAN_CLUST_FLAG_NOT_ZCL as well.

briefdescription.para: this cluster is NOT using the ZigBee Cluster Library (ZCL)
mask of WPAN_CLUST_FLAG_* flags for the cluster tied to this envelope
frame was received on a broadcast address
frame was received on the broadcast endpoint (0xFF)
frame was received with APS encryption
Cluster ID used to mark the end of cluster_table in wpan_endpoint_table_entry_t.
Macro for a wpan_cluster_table_entry_t that can be used to mark the end of the table.
device has joined a network (but not necessarily authenticated)
device completed Key Establishment and can send APS encrypted frames
device has encryption enabled (EO non-zero)
Macro to test whether a device has joined the network.

parameterdescription.para: (wpan_dev_t FAR *) to test
device has not joined the network
device has joined the network

briefdescription.para: Macro to test whether a device has authenticated with the trust center.

parameterdescription.para: (wpan_dev_t FAR *) to test
device has authenticated
device has not authenticated

briefdescription.para: Endpoint ID used to mark the end of endpoint_table in wpan_dev_t.

memberdef.definition: typedef int(* wpan_aps_handler_fn) (const wpan_envelope_t FAR *envelope, void FAR *context)
memberdef.name: wpan_aps_handler_fn

briefdescription.para: General handler used in the cluster table.

detaileddescription.para: Dispatcher searches an endpoint's cluster table for a matching cluster, and hands the frame off to the cluster's handler.
If the cluster's handler is set to NULL, or the frame is for a cluster ID that does not appear in the table, the dispatcher hands the frame off to the endpoint's handler.

parameterdescription.para: information about the frame (addresses, endpoint, profile, cluster, etc.)
user context (from cluster table)
handled data
some sort of error processing data

memberdef.definition: typedef int(* wpan_ep_handler_fn) (const wpan_envelope_t FAR *envelope, struct wpan_ep_state_t FAR *ep_state)
memberdef.name: wpan_ep_handler_fn

briefdescription.para: General handler used in the endpoint table.

detaileddescription.para: If a cluster's handler is set to NULL, or the frame is for a cluster ID that does not appear in the table, the dispatcher hands the frame off to the endpoint's handler.

parameterdescription.para: information about the frame (addresses, endpoint, profile, cluster, etc.)
pointer to endpoint state structure
handled data
some sort of error processing data

memberdef.definition: typedef int(* wpan_endpoint_send_fn) (const wpan_envelope_t FAR *envelope, uint16_t flags)
memberdef.name: wpan_endpoint_send_fn

briefdescription.para: Function called by the WPAN APS layer to send a frame out on the network.

detaileddescription.para: This is part of the glue that links the XBee layer with the WPAN/ZigBee layers.

parameterdescription.para: information about the frame (addresses, endpoint, profile, cluster, payload, etc.)

flags related to sending, see WPAN_SEND_FLAG_* macros
#WPAN_SEND_FLAG_NONE: no special behavior
#WPAN_SEND_FLAG_ENCRYPTED: use APS layer encryption
frame sent
error sending frame
payload is too large

xrefdescription.para: Add support for a broadcast radius? Don't send Tx Status? Use frame ID 0?
come up with standard error codes for the following possible errors? outbound frame buffer is full, invalid data in envelope, payload is too big

briefdescription.para: Function called by the WPAN APS layer to configure the underlying network device.

internal.para: Exact implementation is currently undefined, but this entry exists for future expansion of the API.

parameterdescription.para: device to configure
variable arguments to the function
configuration request processed successfully
error parsing parameter #retval

briefdescription.para: Function called by the WPAN APS layer to have the underlying device read and dispatch frames.

parameterdescription.para: device to tick

simplesect.para: number of frames processed during the tick

memberdef.definition: typedef const wpan_endpoint_table_entry_t*(* wpan_endpoint_get_next_fn) (struct wpan_dev_t *dev, const wpan_endpoint_table_entry_t *ep)
memberdef.name: wpan_endpoint_get_next_fn

briefdescription.para: Custom function for walking the endpoint table.

detaileddescription.para: The application can define its own function to walk the endpoint table, possibly to support a dynamic table or a table where endpoints aren't always visible.

parameterdescription.para: device with endpoint table to walk
NULL to return first entry in table, or a pointer previously returned by this function to get the next entry
dev is invalid or reached end of table
next entry from table

memberdef.definition: typedef int(* wpan_response_fn) (struct wpan_conversation_t FAR *conversation, const wpan_envelope_t FAR *envelope)
memberdef.name: wpan_response_fn

briefdescription.para: Handler registered with wpan_conversation_register() to process responses to outstanding requests.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to entry in conversation table. Handler can use the pointer to access the context and transaction ID from the conversation, or request deletion of the conversation via wpan_conversation_delete(). Never NULL.
envelope with response or NULL if there was a timeout
end of conversation, no more responses expected
leave conversation open, more responses are expected

briefdescription.para: Calls the underlying hardware tick function to process received frames, and times out expired conversations.

parameterdescription.para: WPAN device to tick
number of frames processed during the tick
device does not have a tick function assigned to it
some other error encountered during the tick

briefdescription.para: Search a cluster table for a matching cluster ID.

parameterdescription.para: ID to match

Flags to match against the flags member of the wpan_cluster_table_entry_t structure. If any flags match, the entry is returned. Typically one of
WPAN_CLUST_FLAG_INPUT (or WPAN_CLUST_FLAG_SERVER)
WPAN_CLUST_FLAG_OUTPUT (or WPAN_CLUST_FLAG_CLIENT)
pointer to list of entries to search
entry is invalid or search reached WPAN_CLUSTER_END_OF_LIST without finding a match.
Pointer to matching entry from table.

briefdescription.para: Function used to walk a device's endpoint table.

detaileddescription.para: For most devices, this will just walk the entries in dev->endpoint_table. For custom applications a function may dynamically return entries.
Use of this function is the only way to walk the endpoint table.

parameterdescription.para: device with endpoint table to walk
NULL to return first entry in table, or a pointer previously returned by this function to get the next entry
dev is invalid or reached end of table
next entry from table

briefdescription.para: Walk a device's endpoint table looking for a matching endpoint ID and profile ID.

detaileddescription.para: Used by the endpoint dispatcher and ZDO layer to describe available endpoints on this device.

parameterdescription.para: Device with endpoint table to search.
Endpoint number to search for.
Profile to match or WPAN_APS_PROFILE_ANY to search on endpoint number only.
dev is invalid or reached end of table without finding a match
next entry from table

briefdescription.para: Look up the endpoint table entry for the source endpoint of an envelope.

parameterdescription.para: Envelope for lookup. Uses env->source_endpoint and env->profile_id to find the endpoint table entry for env->dev.
invalid parameter, or reached end of table without finding a match
entry from table

memberdef.argsstring: (wpan_dev_t *dev, uint16_t profile_id, uint16_t cluster_id, uint8_t mask)
memberdef.name: wpan_endpoint_of_cluster

briefdescription.para: Walk a device's endpoint table looking for a matching profile ID and cluster ID.

detaileddescription.para: Used to find the correct endpoint to use for sending ZCL client requests.

parameterdescription.para: Device with endpoint table to search.
Profile to match or WPAN_APS_PROFILE_ANY to search on cluster ID only.
Cluster ID to search for.

Flags to match against the flags member of the wpan_cluster_table_entry_t structure. If any flags match, the entry is returned. Typically one of
WPAN_CLUST_FLAG_INPUT (or WPAN_CLUST_FLAG_SERVER)
WPAN_CLUST_FLAG_OUTPUT (or WPAN_CLUST_FLAG_CLIENT)
dev is invalid or reached end of table without finding a match
matching entry from table

memberdef.argsstring: (wpan_envelope_t *envelope, wpan_dev_t *dev, const addr64 FAR *ieee, uint16_t network_addr)
memberdef.name: wpan_envelope_create

briefdescription.para: Starting with a blank envelope, fill in the device, 64-bit IEEE address and 16-bit network address of the destination.

detaileddescription.para: The profile ID, cluster ID, source/destination endpoints and envelope options are all be set to zero.

envelope
envelope to populate
dev
device that will send this envelope
ieee
64-bit IEEE/MAC address of recipient or one of
WPAN_IEEE_ADDR_COORDINATOR (send to coordinator)
WPAN_IEEE_ADDR_BROADCAST (broadcast packet)
WPAN_IEEE_ADDR_UNDEFINED (use network address only)
network_addr
16-bit network address of recipient or one of
WPAN_NET_ADDR_COORDINATOR for the coordinator (use the coordinator's actual IEEE address for the ieee parameter).
WPAN_NET_ADDR_BCAST_ALL_NODES (broadcast to all nodes)
WPAN_NET_ADDR_BCAST_NOT_ASLEEP (broadcast to awake nodes)
WPAN_NET_ADDR_BCAST_ROUTERS (broadcast to routers/coordinator)
WPAN_NET_ADDR_UNDEFINED (use 64-bit address only)
When sending broadcast packets, use WPAN_IEEE_ADDR_BROADCAST and WPAN_NET_ADDR_UNDEFINED. Don't set both addresses to broadcast.
When using DigiMesh protocol, always set the network_addr to WPAN_NET_ADDR_UNDEFINED.

briefdescription.para: Create a reply envelope based on the envelope received from a remote node.

detaileddescription.para: Copies the interface, addresses, profile and cluster from the original envelope, and then swaps the source and destination endpoints.
Note that it may be necessary for the caller to change the cluster_id as well, after building the reply envelope. For example, ZDO responses set the high bit of the request's cluster ID.

parameterdescription.para: Buffer for storing the reply envelope.
Original envelope, received from a remote node, to base the reply on.
addressed reply envelope
either parameter is NULL or they point to the same address

briefdescription.para: Send a message to an endpoint using address and payload information stored in a wpan_envelope_t structure.

parameterdescription.para: envelope of request to send
request sent
error trying to send request

briefdescription.para: Debugging function to dump the contents of an envelope to stdout.

detaileddescription.para: Displays all fields from the envelope, plus the contents of the payload

parameterdescription.para: envelope to dump

memberdef.argsstring: (wpan_ep_state_t FAR *state, wpan_response_fn handler, const void FAR *context, uint16_t timeout)
memberdef.name: wpan_conversation_register

briefdescription.para: Add a conversation to the table of tracked conversations.

parameterdescription.para: endpoint state associated with sending endpoint
handler to call when responses come back, or NULL to increment and return the endpoint's transaction ID
pointer stored in conversation table and passed to callback handler
number of seconds before generating timeout, or 0 for none
transaction ID to use in sent frame
state is invalid (NULL)
table is full

memberdef.argsstring: (wpan_ep_state_t FAR *state, uint8_t transaction_id, const wpan_envelope_t FAR *envelope)
memberdef.name: wpan_conversation_response

briefdescription.para: Searches the endpoint's table of active conversations (outstanding requests waiting for responses) for a given transaction.

detaileddescription.para: Hands the response frame off to the handler registered to the conversation with wpan_conversation_register().

parameterdescription.para: endpoint state (from endpoint table) or NULL to look it up using the envelope
transaction ID from frame payload, used to look up conversation
envelope from response frame, passed to conversation's handler
invalid parameter passed to function, or conversation not found in table
handler processed response
handler reported an error while processing response

briefdescription.para: Increment and return the endpoint's transaction ID counter.

parameterdescription.para: entry from endpoint table
current transaction ID for endpoint

briefdescription.para: Find the matching endpoint for the provided envelope and have it process the frame.

detaileddescription.para: In the case of the broadcast endpoint (255), dispatches the frame to all endpoints matching the envelope's profile ID.
Looks up the destination endpoint and cluster ID in the device's endpoint table and passes envelope off to the cluster handler (if a matching cluster was found) or the endpoint handler.

parameterdescription.para: structure containing all necessary information about message (endpoints, cluster, profile, etc.)
successfully dispatched message
no handler for this endpoint/cluster
error dispatching messages

briefdescription.para: Delete a conversation from an endpoint's conversation table.

parameterdescription.para: conversation to delete

briefdescription.para: Cluster/Endpoint layer for WPAN networks (ZigBee and DigiMesh).
